1.name: Pancake
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon salt, or more to taste
steps: Sift the dry ingredients together.
Make a well, then add the wet ingredients. Stir to combine.
Check whether the pan is moderate heat. Scoop the batter onto a hot griddle or pan.
Cook for two to three minutes, then flip. Cook the other side for three minutes until it gets brown.
Continue cooking until brown on both sides. Serve it with jam or honey.

2.name: Woknudlar
steps: Boil the noodles in hot water for ten minutes. Shred the chicken and mix with soy. Fry in oil with salt, pepper and curry.
Fry the wok vegetables and press over the garlic.
Cook the noodles and drain.
Mix all ingredients and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Serve with sweet chili sauce.

3.name: Lasagna
steps: Preheat the oven to gas 6, 200°C, fan 180°C. Heat the oil in a frying pan.
Add the chicken and brown. Set aside in a bowl.
Add the onion and garlic to the pan; cook for 5 mins, or until softened.
Stir in the oregano, chili, tomato purée, and tomatoes, then return the chicken with any juices; season. Bring to the boil, then simmer for 5 mins.
For the sauce, melt the butter in a pan, then stir in the flour; cook for 1 min.
Gradually add the milk. Bring to the boil, then simmer, stirring, for 5 mins. Remove from the heat. Stir in 60g cheese and the mustard; season.
Spoon half the chicken mixture into a small baking dish. Top with 2 lasagne sheets, then the remaining chicken.
Top with the last 2 lasagne sheets. Pour over the sauce and scatter over the remaining cheese. Bake for 20 mins, or until golden.

4.name: Briyani
steps: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a low heat. Add the onion, cover and cook for 10 minutes until softened.
Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces, tip into a bowl, and add the lemon juice, garam masala, chili powder, and salt. Stir well to coat.
Rinse the rice several times in cold water, until the water runs clear.
Add the garlic and ginger to the onion and cook for 2 minutes, then add the chicken pieces and cook for a further 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the rice and hot stock to the pan, stir well then bring to the boil. Cover with a tight-fitting lid, reduce the heat slightly and cook for 5 minutes.
Turn off the heat and leave the pan for 10 minutes to allow the rice to finish cooking in the steam.
Do not remove the lid. Stir through the coriander and serve immediately.

5.name: Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 Tbsp rice bran or vegetable oil
½ cup frozen vegetables of your choice
Finely sliced spring onion, if desired
steps: Bring a wok or large pan to a high heat with the oil.
Once heated, add the rice and garlic, then stir fry for 4-5 minutes.
Push the rice to the side of the pan, and pour the beaten egg into the empty side. Stir to scramble, then stir through the rice.
Pour the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil into the rice.
Stir to combine, then fold through the frozen vegetables and cook for 3-4 minutes or until cooked through.
Add the butter and stir until melted, then serve immediately.

6.name: Tandoori
steps: Mix the lemon juice with the paprika and red onions in a large shallow dish.
Slash each chicken thigh three times, then turn them in the juice and set aside for 10 mins.
Mix all of the marinade ingredients together and pour over the chicken.
Give everything a good mix, then cover and chill for at least 1 hr. This can be done up to a day in advance.
Heat the grill. Lift the chicken pieces onto a rack over a baking tray.
Brush over a little oil and grill for 8 mins on each side or until lightly charred and completely cooked through.
